title: Gila Cliff Dwellings National Monument: Rivers and Streams
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Natural Features & Ecosystems     Rivers and Streams                Rivers and Streams         Gila River viewed from Route 15 NPS Photo by Barry Nielsen  Gila Cliff Dwellings National Monument lies at the confluence of the West and Middle Forks of the Gila River. At this point the rivers are usually less than fifty feet wide and about a foot deep. Hikers should be aware that during the rainy season of July-September, runoff from rains in distant canyons may create flash floods. Gila River flow data maintained by US Geological Suvey
